insights: Input to your Strategy for Adapting to Challenges

The ANZ survey also showed a rise in the average expectation for where inflation will be in two years to 4.9% from 4.7% in May. This is the highest reading since April 2023 and is up from the low of 3.8% last December.

The graph here shows that the upward trend is fairly decisive. This backs up the view I’ve been expressing since August last year that inflation in New Zealand remains a threat and scope for extra easing of monetary policy is probably much less than many people are thinking.
